body_html:
The fact that it returns different tensors shapes based on the file format is not the 'usual' tensoflow way.
Can we just return the first frame in case of a gif image instead? If the user really wants the whole gif sequence then they can use the specialized version. This function will be very useful when you have mixed images formats in your data folder.
body_text:
The fact that it returns different tensors shapes based on the  file format is not the 'usual' tensoflow way.
Can we just return the first frame in case of a gif image instead? If the user really wants the whole gif sequence then they can use the specialized version. This function will be very useful when you have mixed images formats in your data folder.
body:
The fact that it returns different tensors shapes based on the  file format is not the 'usual' tensoflow way.
Can we just return the first frame in case of a gif image instead? If the user *really* wants the whole gif sequence then they can use the specialized version. This function will be very useful when you have mixed images formats in your data folder.
